main event: On September 8, 1959, Mr. X observed a bright object in the sky while driving near Wallingford, Kentucky, described as moving rapidly westward.
interesting points: The object was referred to as glowing phosphorescent light and appeared to be at an altitude of approximately 3,000 feet., The object was sighted for about 10 minutes and exhibited sudden movements., Witnesses described the object as about the size of a basketball illuminating the area., The sighting was concluded as likely being a meteor or natural phenomenon., The case was documented as UNIDENTIFIED with no confirmed identification.
sighted object: one bright glowing object in the sky
witness description: Mr. John Wills and Mrs. Elizabeth Wills are considered reliable witnesses.
